author: SnappedTogether
title: The Pelican Way
review: This poly-bag was purchased at a Target store along with Emmet Mini Master-Building bag, both are pretty nice sets.  This pelican made me laugh simply by the smirk on his/her face on the bag.  Put it together and not disappointed, good set to have on my office desk.

author: GreenGirl
title: Great gift for birders
review: I enjoyed building this. It is joyful. I’m rediscovering LEGO and sweet sets like this sent me back to store for more. Great gift set. Quick build. Great for young and old alike.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Excellent Offering from Creator.
review:
Set #30571 Pelican: This Polybag is another 3-in-1 creature build. The main model is a using Mixel parts for creating a solid brick-built Pelican. You can rebuild the model into a rabbit and what seems to be a parrot or cockatoo judging by the tuft of feather on the top of the model. Now let us discuss the pros and cons before going on the overall thoughts of the set.

Pros:

  • Excellent use of parts for a solid model build.
  • Additional models shown to inspire creativity.
  • Includes buildable bench to stand on and Fish element to feast on.
  • Great price-per-piece ratio.

Cons:

  • Main model falls off bench very easily, SNOT techniques used to prevent attachment of Pelican model to bench resulting in lackluster display options.
  • Secondary models instructions not included physically, online search on LEGO’s site to build alternative models required.
  • Wings seem rather tiny compared to the rest of the model.

Overall opinion

This is a pretty solid 3-in-1 model inclusion. Unlike the Cute Pug the alternative models actually look very nice, as I have not built them yet I can’t comment on their builds, but based on pictures I do find them looking very solid and a good use of parts. I’d strongly recommend getting a few of these, the parts alone are worth the cost of admission as they included some nice elements. Overall recommended.

author: KarolWes
title: Angry Pelican

Body and tail are also designed very nice.

author: couchz
title: Pelican Review
review:
Pelican in the set is kind of funny to me, with its overly big mouth, squinting eyes, and tiny wings. Even though I had it for more than a year, it still stands out and makes me laugh.

 

Prose 

 

This set has a nice range of pieces. The bright light orange cabinet piece is used as the lower jaw. Or the (Modified 1 x 2 with Rock / Fingers) used as the feathers for the Pelican. It also comes with a flat, silver,fish piece which is always useful and playful. The set was released under the Creator 3 in 1  theme, meaning it has two other alternate models; the instructions for them have to be downloaded from lego.com. The primary model has a good range of possibilities for such a small set. The mouth can go up and down, the wings have 365 rotations, and its feet go side to side.

 

Alternate models 

 

The primary model is the best out of the three; the other two are kind of lackluster to me. While I was building one of the two alternate models, I realized the set's colors were the palette for the pelican. The bunny is an alright model. It is very limited articulation, and its color seems slightly off, but if you can envision a bunny. On the other hand, I enjoy the cockatiel much more than the bunny.  Its colors work well and the way they use certain pieces like the 1 by 3 corner plate as the wings. The color scheme works well with the blue wings and bright light orange scattered throughout the build. The alternate models are okay, but I prefer the original one. 

 

Cons 

In my opinion, the set doesn't really have that many problems with the set. Are the alternate models specifically the bunny? Besides that, I think the other models are fine. The Pelican makes a fun little display piece and the parts are okay. Many of the problems I have with this set,I would just chalk up to it being meant for younger kids, aged 5-7 years old.

  

Overall though 

I enjoy this set, and it makes a fun little display piece on my shelf. 

The alternate models are just good for a polybag set. It also has a good range of pieces. The set was released in 2019, so it's not sold in stores anymore. If you want to get it on the second-hand Market from eBay, you can get it for about $10. Seal on but on Bricklink you can get it for about $4 used.
